thread.title: Arsenal News: Rafa Benitez plays down speculation he will replace Wenger | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal News: Rafa Benitez plays down speculation he will replace Wenger | Metro News

author: Metro Sport Reporter For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal News: Rafa Benitez plays down speculation he will replace Wenger | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news metro sport reporter for metro.co.uk

text:
Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 9:39 am Rafa Benitez’s Newcastle currently lead the Championship by one point from Brighton (Picture: Getty Images) 
Rafael Benitez insists he is fully focused on achieving promotion with Newcastle and his paying no attention to speculation linking him with Arsenal . ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The former Liverpool manager is currently masterminding the Magpies’ attempt to make an instant return to the Premier League following last season’s shock relegation, and looks on course to achieve that target with Newcastle currently top of the Championship. 
Benitez has become the latest name to be linked with replacing Arsene Wenger at the end of the current season, with the long-serving Arsenal boss yes to commit his future to the north London club. Benitez would reportedly look to bring Thierry Henry back to Arsenal should he succeed Arsene Wenger (Picture: Getty Images) 
But the Spaniard, who reportedly wants to bring Thierry Henry back to Arsenal as a coach should he succeed Wenger, attempted to downplay speculation following last night’s 2-2 draw with Norwich. 
‘I’m the manager for Newcastle playing against Norwich and then the next games.’ Benitez said. 
‘That’s it, so I’m just focused on that. As a manager you are used to have clubs talking and the media talking so what you have to do is just concentrate on your job.
